content:
Was just wondering if there are any plans to redesign the Features page on zulipchat.com. While checking out some competitors websites I noticed our features page is very weak since it doesn't do a good job of -

a) Putting high-value features at the very top
b) Creating a simple visual hierarchy so your eye can parse what is essentially a list/grid of features.
c) Making it look like zulip is a high quality application due to poor visual design.

@Rishi Gupta I know you have plans for the home/tour section. Was just wondering if there was anything on the roadmap for the features page since I assume this is the one page on the website that REALLY leads to conversions ( apart from pricing ofcourse )
yeah, agreed that page needs a lot of work. It's not currently on the roadmap, though would be pretty reasonable to start working on it. Tim, thoughts?
I'd be interested in your specific ideas @Armaan Ahluwalia; like, what features do you think should be on top that aren't?

I would answer this question but I think I should give you a more detailed answer than anything off the top of my head if you're really interested. But for one I think threaded topics should be the first feature you see. Followed probably by group private messages aka private channels followed by integrated video. After that the most common use-cases for integrations and their logos should be prominently displayed. After that all the rest of the nice-to-have features like markdown, emojis etc etc
Threading is at the top of zulipchat.com itself.
Right but repetition is not a bad thing in marketing ;)
Its also necessary to have an exhaustive list and you can't presume people enter at zulipchat.com
My other concern is the visual design is honestly really confused. The hierarchy suggests that keyboard shortcuts and notifications are the most prominent features in zulip.
Its probably useful to do a small comparison across competitor feature pages.
hi @irv can you use #test here for testing? thanks!
hey @Steve Howell , will do! Thanks and keep up the good work :)
